title: (x) Folsom Cordova Unified School District - Pretorian/Vivian {Mike Y, Yves}
content: It's an Art Nouveau-era typeface called "Pretorian" according to the Dover book by Petzendorfer. FontBank issued it as [Vivian](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819123039/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/vivian.htm)
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
And there is a free font called.......   
oh wait.....can I say that on this forum?

If you mean 'foiled' because I listed an alias version, I would bet that the FontBank font predates the DTP one in digital form. The FontBank fonts were done in 1990-92. MyFonts says that DTP 'designed' Pretorian in 1992. The actual typeface was designed by 'P.M. Shanks & Sons, Ltd' in London, probably 100 years before either digital version.
Oops....sorry about that, Yves. I read through the thread you linked. I'm sure the one I (didn't) mention falls in the rip-off category.
